Vertex Mutable Graph

A vertex mutable graph can be changed by adding or removing vertices. The memory management is the responsibility of the graph implementation. The graph user need only make calls to add_vertex and remove_vertex and the graph implementation does the rest.

Refinement of

Graph and DefaultConstructible

Associated Types

No additional associated types.

Valid Expressions

  • add_vertex(g) returns vertex_descriptor

    Semantics: Add a new vertex to the graph. The vertex_descriptor for the new vertex is returned.
  • remove_vertex(u, g) returns void

    Semantics: Remove u from the vertex set of the graph.
    Preconditions: u is a valid vertex descriptor of graph g and there are no edges incident to vertex u. The function clear_vertex can be used to remove all incident edges.
    Postconditions: num_vertices(g) is one less; u no longer appears in the vertex set of the graph and it is no longer a valid vertex descriptor.

Complexity guarantees

  • Vertex insertion is guaranteed to be amortized constant time.
  • Vertex removal is at most O(|E| + |V|).
